Operation 'check' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, unclear_purpose, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Check' is too generic and doesn't indicate what is being checked. Description is vague about purpose and doesn't explain what constitutes success or what the response indicates. Improved version clarifies this is a health/validation endpoint, explains its use case for AI agents (pre-execution verification), and describes the expected outcome.

data.current_description: Test that the API and auth are working.
data.description_suggestion: Validates that the API is operational and the provided authentication credentials are valid. This is a health check endpoint that can be used to verify connectivity and authentication before executing actions. Returns a success response if both API and authentication are working correctly.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Check' is too generic and doesn't indicate what is being checked. Description is vague about purpose and doesn't explain what constitutes success or what the response indicates. Improved version clarifies this is a health/validation endpoint, explains its use case for AI agents (pre-execution verification), and describes the expected outcome.

message: Operation 'get_configuration_link' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Summary lacks clarity about what type of link is returned. Description mentions alternatives but doesn't clearly explain what this endpoint returns or when an AI agent should use it versus alternatives. Improved version clarifies the return value (URL), the purpose (configuration interface), and when to use this versus search-based alternatives.

data.current_description: Provides a link to configure more actions. Alternatively, searching through apps and actions will provide more specific configuration links.
data.description_suggestion: Returns a URL link that directs to the configuration interface for setting up additional actions. This endpoint provides a general configuration entry point. For more specific configuration needs, individual action configuration links can be obtained through app and action search operations. The returned link enables users to discover and configure new actions available in the system.
data.reasoning: Summary lacks clarity about what type of link is returned. Description mentions alternatives but doesn't clearly explain what this endpoint returns or when an AI agent should use it versus alternatives. Improved version clarifies the return value (URL), the purpose (configuration interface), and when to use this versus search-based alternatives.

message: Operation 'execute_app_action_endpoint' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, unclear_purpose, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is generic and doesn't indicate execution. Description is confusing - it reads like instructions to the user rather than documentation. Missing critical details: path parameter requirement, request schema details, response schema, and side effects. Improved version clarifies the action being performed, required inputs (path parameter and request body), expected output (ExecuteResponse), and warns about potential side effects for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Give us a plain english description of exact action you want to do. There should be dynamically generated documentation for this endpoint for each action that is exposed.
data.description_suggestion: Executes a specific exposed action for the authenticated account. Requires the exposed_app_action_id path parameter to identify which action to execute. The request body should contain an ExecuteRequest with a plain English description of the desired action and any required parameters. Returns an ExecuteResponse containing the action results and execution status. This endpoint performs the actual action execution and may have side effects depending on the specific action being executed (e.g., creating records, sending messages, modifying data). Each exposed action has dynamically generated documentation describing its specific parameters and behavior.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic and doesn't indicate execution. Description is confusing - it reads like instructions to the user rather than documentation. Missing critical details: path parameter requirement, request schema details, response schema, and side effects. Improved version clarifies the action being performed, required inputs (path parameter and request body), expected output (ExecuteResponse), and warns about potential side effects for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'get_execution_log_endpoint' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Summary uses generic 'Endpoint' terminology and doesn't clearly indicate what information is retrieved. Description is minimal and doesn't explain what the execution log contains or why an AI agent would use this operation. Improved version clarifies the return value (execution log details), the purpose (tracking outcomes, debugging), and the required parameter, making it more useful for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Get the execution log for a given execution log id.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the execution log for a previously executed action using the execution_log_id path parameter. The execution log contains detailed information about the action execution including status, results, timestamps, and any errors or warnings that occurred. This endpoint is useful for tracking action outcomes and debugging failed executions.
data.reasoning: Summary uses generic 'Endpoint' terminology and doesn't clearly indicate what information is retrieved.
